.
Establishing Permanence for Chronic, Progressive Disabilities
When evidence indicates that cancer or other similarly chronic and progressive disabilities are not expected to improve, concede permanence for the disability evaluation.Â  Examples of indicators suggesting the likelihood that the disability status is permanent include but are not limited to
a prescription for palliative treatment only for a cancer diagnosis
a prescription for hospice care, or
an indicator in medical evidence that the condition is considered terminal.
